ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Taking a directed reading course on Jurgen Moltmanns theology, work that is exemplary in contemporary systematic theologians its attentiveness to social and political concerns alongside doctrinal commitments, with Professor Volf whose intellectual and personal familiarity with Jurgen Moltmann makes this a unique opportunity. I would recommend the class to any student of theology.
Yes, absolutely. I hope that others have similar opportunities to study Moltmann's theology with Prof. Volf.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Having the opportunity to discuss the historical situation within which Moltmann wrote as well as the continuing debate concerning Moltmann's legacy as a theologian definitely incised my knowledge of the field of theology, and I certainly think that my dissertation research and topic will be informed by the conversations we had during our meetings, as well as by the final paper and Prof. Volf's feedback on it.
